conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram to understand the thermodynamic process.
The image shows a p-V diagram of an ideal gas changing from state A to B to C. Temperature at state A is 27°C. Process A to B is isothermal, B to C is adiabatic.
State A is isothermal, so temperature remains constant from A to B.
Temperature at state A is 27°C, which is 300 K.
Using ideal gas equation for state B, find n = pV/RT.
For adiabatic process B to C, calculate work done using W = (p1V1 - p2V2)/(γ - 1).
Change in internal energy ΔU for isothermal process A to B is zero.
Using first law of thermodynamics, Q = ΔU + W, heat transferred from A to C is work done during adiabatic process.
Amount of heat transferred by the gas is the work done during adiabatic process B to C.
